info.title: TONIC. for Publishers API
info.description: This is the documentation for the "TONIC. for Publishers API". Currently this API is in beta and is subject to change. If you have any questions or feedback, please contact your Account Manager.

get.description: Returns the users mail, available campaign types, first- and lastname. In case of a subuser it will also return its role and the associated rights.

get.description: Returns a list of articles. The results can be filtered and sorted by a specified field and direction.

parameters.name: articleIds
parameters.description:
Filter by article IDs.
Pass multiple values separated by commas.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Filter by campaign name (case-insensitive, min. 3 characters).

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Filter by domain

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Filter by 2 digits language code

parameters.name: verticalIds
parameters.description:
Filter by vertical IDs
Pass multiple values separated by commas.

parameters.name: verticalName
parameters.description: Filter by vertical name (case-insensitive, min. 3 characters).

parameters.name: offerIds
parameters.description:
Filter by Offer IDs
Pass multiple values separated by commas.

parameters.name: offerName
parameters.description: Filter by Offer name (case-insensitive, min. 3 characters).

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description:
Filter by country code
Pass multiple values separated by commas.

parameters.name: orderField
parameters.description:
Sort results by field.
Available Values : id, title, created, offer_name, vertical_name, country_name, country_code, language, connected_campaigns

parameters.name: orderOrientation
parameters.description: Sort direction: asc (A-Z) or desc (Z-A).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of returned paginated data

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of returned paginated data

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Stats start date.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Stats end date (max range: 31 days).

patch.description:
You can change campaign names, status, imprint settings, keyword amount, keywords, S2S callbacks, or tracking targets.
Endpoint requires an array of datasets in post body.

The entire request fails if:

  • Only `id` is provided for any dataset
  • Any validation error occurs
  • More than 100 datasets are sent
  • Any campaign update fails

Status
Activating a campaign that is not ready will set it to `pending` until all requirements are met.

S2S Callbacks
A GET request is sent to the provided URL, with placeholders replaced by matching query parameters.

Placeholders:
`{campaign_id}`, `{campaign_name}`, `{currency}`, `{device}`, `{event_id}`, `{keyword}`, `{revenue}`, `{timestamp}`, `{type}`


All tracking link URL parameters can be used as placeholders. If you include a parameter named foo=bar in the tracking link, the template variable {foo} will be available and replaced with bar.


Example: https://tracktest.com/?subid1=test1&subid2=test2&source=network&type={type}&foo={foo}


Notes:

  • URLs must start with http:// or https://
  • Callbacks are campaign-specific
  • If 100+ errors occur without a successful call, callbacks are paused
  • Global S2S settings are used by default; campaign-level settings override them

id.description: Campaign ID to update. Must be provided for each dataset.

imprint.description: Enable or disable imprint for this campaign

keywords.description: List of keywords for this campaign

s2sCallbacks.description: Object with callback URLs for each event type

viewRt.description: URL for viewRt (realted term click) callback

estimatedRevenue5h.description: URL for estimated revenue after 5 hours callback

get.description: Returns a list of ad ids and their compliance status for a given network. A declined or misalligned ad id can not be monitazed with Tonic.

parameters.name: campaignIds
parameters.description:
Filter by campaign IDs.
Pass multiple values separated by commas.

parameters.name: campaignName
parameters.description: Filter by campaign name (case-insensitive, min. 3 characters).

parameters.name: adIds
parameters.description:
Filter by ad id (case-insensitive).
Pass multiple values separated by commas.

parameters.name: networks
parameters.description:
Filter by network of the ad id.
Pass multiple values separated by commas.
Available Values : facebook, outbrain, taboola, mgid, tiktok

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Filter by status
Available Values : allowed, declined

parameters.name: withCampaignName
parameters.description: If true, the campaign name will be returned as well

parameters.name: hasReviewRequest
parameters.description: Filter by Ad ID presence compliance review request. true: only ad ids with a review request; false: only ad ids without.

parameters.name: hasComplianceStatusChangeDate
parameters.description: Filter by Ad ID presence complience status change. true: only ad ids with a change date; false: only ad ids without.

parameters.name: orderField
parameters.description:
Sort results by field.
Available Values : campaignId, campaignName, adId, network, status, lastCheck

parameters.name: orderOrientation
parameters.description: Sort direction: asc (A-Z) or desc (Z-A).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of returned paginated data

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of returned paginated data

data.adIdAlignment: The ad is not compliant because it promises a discount where it is not allowed.

reviewRequest.message: This ad ID was mistakenly flagged as non-compliant because...

get.summary: Get ad id compliance status change log
get.description:
Retrieve a log of changes to the compliance status of ad IDs.
The log can be filtered by ad ID, campaign ID, campaign name (partial match), and date range (max 3 days). If no date range is given, you will receive the data for today. Results can be sorted by various fields and paginated.

parameters.name: adId
parameters.description: Filter by ad ID.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: Filter by campaign ID.

parameters.name: campaignName
parameters.description: Filter by campaign name (partial match).

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Date range start.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Date range end (max range: 3 days).

parameters.name: orderField
parameters.description:
Sort results by field.
Available Values : campaignId, campaignName, adId, network, changeType, prevStatus, newStatus, checkedAt

parameters.name: orderOrientation
parameters.description: Sort direction: asc (A-Z) or desc (Z-A).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination offset.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Results per page (default 25, max 100).

post.summary: Send a review request for a disallowed ad id
post.description: You can send a review request for a disallowed ad id. This will be reviewed by the Trust & Safety team and may lead to a change in the compliance status of the ad id.

campaignId.description: The campaign ID associated with the ad ID

adId.description: The ad ID for which you want to send the review request.

message.description: A detailed message explaining why the compliance status for this ad ID should be reconsidered.
message.example: This ad ID was mistakenly flagged as non-compliant because...

post.summary: Create a redirect report for campaigns.
post.description: This starts a job that runs for some time.</br>Report download links to reports are available for 7 days. Format is CSV.</br>Please see the schema on what options you have to receive or access the report.

dateFrom.description: The start date of the report.

dateTo.description: The end date of the report. If not given, the 'dateFrom' parameter marks start and end date of the report.

columns.description:
List of columns like 'campaign_name' and 'device_type'.
  • You can also specify all parameters of your tracking-link you sent to tonic (e.g. siteid, subid1, subid4, adtitle).
  • If you add 'querystring', the whole querysting comes up in a seperate column.
  • For RSoC Campaigns: If you add 'problematic_ad_id', preferably in addition to 'ad_id', you will receive a column that identifies with yes/no whether the received 'ad_id' looks suspicious.
  • For RSoC Campaigns: The columns 'ad_blocked' and 'ad_blocked_reason' are available, specifying whether a redirect was not monetized and why.

schedule.description: The schedule of the report. Default: 'on-demand'.

url.description: Url for callback of type get.

columns.description: List of columns like 'campaign_name' and 'device_type'.</br>You can also specify all parameters of your tracking-link you sent to tonic (e.g. siteid, subid1, subid4, adtitle).</br>If you add 'querystring', the whole querysting comes up in a seperate column.

schedule.description: The schedule of the report. Default: 'on-demand'.

get.summary: Get further information about the statistics
get.description: Get information about the last payment-closed month, the last finalized date, when it was finalized and the exact date and time until which the estimation update is currently applied to the revenue of clicks.

network.description: The network the ad id is associated with

adIdAlignment.description: The explanation of the ad id alignment status
adIdAlignment.example: The ad is not compliant because it promises a discount where it is not allowed.

lastCheck.description: Date and time of the last check (PDT/PST)

adLibraryLink.description: Library link to the ad by external platform

oneOf.description: Additional metadata related to the ad ID. This can include various key-value pairs that provide extra context about the ad itself, such as adgroup_id for TikTok.
The actual content of the ad, such as text, images, or videos. This field provides insight into what the ad contains, which can be useful for compliance reviews and assessments.

complianceStatusChangeDate.description: This field indicates the date and time when the compliance will change. Due to changing compliance requirements or false positives from our automated detection system, an ad that is currently compliant may later be flagged as non-compliant

adId.description: The ad ID that experienced the status change.

campaignId.description: The campaign id associated with the ad ID.

network.description: The network the ad id is associated with

changeType.description: The type of change that occurred.

prevStatus.description: The previous status of the ad ID before the change.

newStatus.description: The new status of the ad ID after the change.

checkedAt.description: The date and time when the ad was checked and the status change occurred.

adLibraryLink.description: Library link to the ad by external platform

countryCode.description: The country code for the new article. Use `WO` for worldwide.

offerId.description: The ID of the offer associated with the article request. Get the offer ID from the [offer list endpoint](#/Offers/OffersGet) filtered by campaign type 'rsoc'.

domain.description: The domain of the RSOC site where the article will be published. Get available domains and their supported languages from the [account endpoint](#/Account/AccountGet) in the `availableRsocDomains` field.

language.description: The intended language of the article (IETF language tag / BCP 47). Get available languages for each domain from the [account endpoint](#/Account/AccountGet) in the `availableRsocDomains` field.

phrases.description:
Phrases to guide content generation. Ensure these align with the article and preceding ad creatives. For example, if the ad promotes 'weight loss', the article should provide comprehensive weight loss advice, not general health tips or unrelated topics.
  • Create 3-5 phrases that expand on the teaser, maintaining consistency and relevance throughout the article.
  • Use these phrases to create detailed and informative sections that support the main topic. Ensure all content is original and not misleading.
  • Avoid content that overpromises or misleads the reader.

Either 'phrases' or 'title' or both must be provided. If phrases are provided, the title becomes optional.

title.description:
A concise and accurate title that clearly represents the content of the article and aligns with the initial ad creatives. Avoid misleading or exaggerated claims.
  • Ensure the title is specific and relevant to the article's topic. Do not use sensational language or promises that can't be delivered.
  • Avoid using phrases that imply a reward or incentive for clicking. Do not include concrete prices, false endorsements, or time-sensitive offers.

Either 'title' or 'phrases' or both must be provided. If phrases are not provided, this field becomes required.
Required when 'phrases' is empty or not provided

teaser.description:
An engaging opening paragraph that gives a clear idea of the article's content. Avoid vague or overly broad statements.
  • The teaser should provide enough information to capture interest without making false promises. Ensure it aligns with the headline and main content.
  • Avoid references to sensitive issues or promises of unrealistic outcomes.
  • The teaser should be at least 250 characters long, with a maximum length of 1000 characters.

citationLink.description: You may add 1 URL from a reputable third-party source that provides factual validation for the article's content. This enhances the credibility of your ad flow while ensuring compliance. Please note, this feature is not available by default and needs to be enabled for your account. Contact your account manager for more information.

articleId.description: The ID of the article associated with the new campaign. Get the article ID from the [articles list endpoint](#/Articles/ArticlesGet). Only published articles can be used to create a campaign.

imprint.description: Show imprint information. Default is true for EU countries, false for non-EU countries.

collectionIndex.description: Index of dataset in the collection where the error occurred

conversionId.description: The Conversion ID is unique per Google Ads account

conversionLabel.description: The Conversion Label is unique per conversion action

status.description: Status of the review request. It is pending until reviewed by the Trust & Safety team. After a decision, the status is updated to accepted or declined.

message.description: The message you sent to the Trust & Safety team.
message.example: This ad ID was mistakenly flagged as non-compliant because...

date.description: the date when the review request was sent to the Trust & Safety team.

comment.example: No longer allowed due to reason
